medium: Charcoal with touches of white chalk
inscribed: in charcoal, on verso lower left: Polly Garey | The Hague

makers.displaydate: 1824–1906; born Lovell, ME; died New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Eastman Johnson, 1824–1906; born Lovell, ME; died New York, NY

texts.textentryhtml: Possibly collection of Eliza Garey and Neville Davison Goldsmid (1814-1875), offered in Goldsmid sales, M. Féral and Charles Pillet, Paris, Catalogue D’Aquarelles et Dessins de l’Ecole Moderne Formant la Collection de feu M. Neville D. Goldsmid de la Haye, May 6, 1876, lot 68 (unsold), and subsequently Van Pappelendam and Schouten, Amsterdam, Catalogue D’Aquarelles et Dessins de l’Ecole Moderne formant les Collections de feu M.M. Abraham Salon d’Amsterdam et Nevile D. Goldsmid de La Haye, February 27, 1877, lot 22; possibly purchased by Johannes Cornelis van Pappelendam (1810-1884) at latter sale (according to inscription in auction catalogue, for f.10). Clifton R. Hall (1884-1945); bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1945.
texts.remarks: Much of this provenance and identification of sitter provided by John Davis of Historic Deerfield. See his correspondence in other Curatorial Notes.
